title: A Tour in Tartan-Land
author: Bede, Cuthbert
snippet: ' Males and females,' says Mr.Reade, ' suck whiskey like milk, and are quarrelsomein proportion; the men fight (round handed), thewomen fleicht or scold in the form of a tea-pot—thehandle fixed, and the spout sawing the air.' An anecdote is told of Dr. Johnstone, once the minister of NorthLeith, who had rebuked a Newhaven fisherman, AdamLucksie by name, for his ignorance in scriptural matters. Adam promised amendment, and the minister left acatechism for the joint benefit of Mr. and Mrs. Lucksie.

title: Waverley Novels. (Abbotsford edition.)
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: " If ye thought that, Doctor Kickherben," saidthe widow, alarmed at the idea of losing cast, " Iwad e'en gang to the show, like other folk; sinfuland shameful if it be, let them that make the sinbear the shame. But then I will put on nane oftheir Popish disguises—me that has lived in NorthLeith, baith wife and lass, for I sbanna say howmony years, aud has a character to keep up baithwith saint and sinner. — And then, wha's to takecare of me, since you are gaun to make a lime-and-stane wa' of yoursell, Doctor Kickinben ?"" My dear Mrs Blower, if such is your deter-mination, I will not make a wall of myself.
